intro: Hauya hemsleyana, commonly known as the Hemsley's hauya, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woolly, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
